reviews.review_msg: Amazing! It's obvious how much Cecile wants students to succeed and properly learn French, as she is so kind, always has an explanation for questions, and creates a really fun and engaging learning environment. Make sure to do the assigned homework and show up to class ready to participate, and you will do just fine!
Good professor, helps students succeed is accessible outside class hours.
She's wonderful.  She has a great personality and really wants students to learn in a comfortable environment.  She's patient & beautiful.  Basically I'm in love with her.
Super good teacher with passionate and patience. Always loves to communicate with students and being very helpful. My favorite prof in sfu <3

The stuff she teaches is not much compare to the other instructors. She teaches alright, but you may want to preview before classes. It does get challenging once she lets you speak right after she teaches you the dialogues once. Review and learn everyday, otherwise don't expect a very good grade.

Totally misjudged her on the first class, she tried making fun of me but basically i told her off. However throught the semester she was very very nice and helpful. She also taught us french revolution history (student rights!) and customs in france (20-30 min all together). She's nice when you get to know her. I would take her again Oui!
her suit case sounded like a tank! she's very nice though! gave us more extra exercises, helpful ones. her stories are funny, straighforward~ encourage ppl 2 think outside the boxes...
